intro: Schismatoglottis batoeensis, commonly known as the Batoe's schismatoglottis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyclanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its elongated, strap-like leaves and distinctive inflorescences that bear small, white to greenish flowers. It typically grows as an epiphyte or terrestrial plant, often in shaded, moist environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
